body:
Previous versions get moved to `old` directory. Fix below issue: 

```
vpn-254-048:zeroeq kumbhar$ spack install -v zeroeq
==> cmake@3.8.2 : externally installed in /usr/local
==> cmake@3.8.2 : already registered in DB
==> Installing libsodium
==> Fetching https://download.libsodium.org/libsodium/releases/libsodium-1.0.11.tar.gz

curl: (22) The requested URL returned error: 404 Not Found
==> Fetching from https://download.libsodium.org/libsodium/releases/libsodium-1.0.11.tar.gz failed.
==> Warning: Spack was unable to fetch url list due to a certificate verification problem. You can try running spack -k, which will not check SSL certificates. Use this at your own risk.
==> Warning: Spack was unable to fetch url list due to a certificate verification problem. You can try running spack -k, which will not check SSL certificates. Use this at your own risk.
==> Could not determine url from list_url.
==> Error: FetchError: All fetchers failed for libsodium-1.0.11-shunkpm6nmcryfwsatnxyhbqdmhpx2lr
FetchError: FetchError: All fetchers failed for libsodium-1.0.11-shunkpm6nmcryfwsatnxyhbqdmhpx2lr

/Users/kumbhar/workarena/software/sources/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:957, in do_fetch:
```
title: Fix libsodium download url and add new version
